Sein < gene 𒄀;𒄀𒈾;𒄀𒅔;𒍻𒂗;𒁺

𓃹𓃺 Sein 𒋗𒉡 šunu 𒅆𒈾 šina 𓆑 𒋗 šu 𒊭 ša sei
𓃹𓃺 اسكن escun
𓃹𓃺 𐍅𐌹𐍃𐌰𐌽 𒀀𒊭𒀀𒀭𒍝
𓃹𓃺 Wesen 𒄷𒍑 ḫu-uš hen हूं 𒀀𒀭 < 𒂗 EN
𓃹𓃺 Being < 𒂗 𓆤 𓆥
𓆑 𒁉 Be Being, Es Bist

𒅊 se₁₂ 𒊺 še 𒍢 ze₂ sei zooⁿ sein hausen "live , dwell" ‘plural stem’

𐀁𐀃 ˢe.oⁿ sein εών ειμί I am 𐀁𐀚𐀁𐀯 ˢe-ne-e-si ενέενσι ειμί they/there are 𐀁𐀒𐀳 e-ko-te έχοντες having (see also ‘ehei’)

Seine Hoheit "you" sen @ Turk 𒍣𒄿𒅅 zi-i-ik, “you”

𒅁𒁀𒋛 ib-ba-si be/sei 𒁀𒀾𒋢𒌑 ba-as-su-u2 was/sei / were

𒋙𒉡𒋾𒈠 šunūtima ‘sent … that were with him‘

𓃹 𓏤 izan @ basque

ⲟⲩⲛ ⲟⲩⲟⲛ there is one
ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲟⲩⲟⲛ there is none

𓇬 𓈖 𓌷 𓂝 | true being, relality | Sein Mwahrheit
𓇬 𓌴 𓐙 | true being, relality |

सही sahī σωστός sostós correct

𓂜𓈖 ein إِنْ ʾin ≠ إِنْ ʾin 𓃹 ∃ sein ≠ sans opposites

Ⰵ Jestu Jestu Є, Е, Э, Ё /ɛ/ Jestъ Yest is/exists Possibly Samaritan īy ࠄ or Greek sampi ϡ[30]
Ⰹ, Ⰺ I, Izhe Izhe Ι, Ї /i/, /j/ Iže Izhe which is/the <?> upsilon Y[35] or iota ϊ[30]

𒊺𒌅 še-tu √set,stay,steh…
𒊺𒌅 leave remaining ⇔ atstāt
⇔
𒊺𒌅 še-tu •h₁s-tó ἐτός
𒊺𒌅 to be, c'est, Ihr seid , Du seist, exist …

स्युः (syuḥ): would be/become स्यात् (syāt): may be विद्यते (vidyate): exists
